topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55349c3463687274e7470700#post_55349c3463687274e7470700
I can't draw digital.
I have to feel the friction of the pencil on the paper or else I'll get lost and ultimately do something stupid.
Besides, you don't erase the entire line. You just erase parts of it and then start there. Afterwards, you just draw while using that line.

[bq="HJSDGCE"]
Besides, you don't erase the entire line. You just erase parts of it and then start there. Afterwards, you just draw while using that line.[/bq]
Tell that to my art teacher

I've had to erase almost entire fully shaded drawings because i made a mistake with the proportions or something
topics.author: 5007bbdf7f123b112f00023a

topics.body:
"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55349d826368724dd38a0c00#post_55349d826368724dd38a0c00
Well... that's not wrong. Proportion is something else and follows a different set of rules. 

But don't erase it completely or else you might make the same mistake that you erased.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body:
"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55349d826368724dd38a0c00#post_55349d826368724dd38a0c00
[bq="PaskaNaakka"]"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55349cc46368722bbea01600#post_55349cc46368722bbea01600
[bq="HJSDGCE"]
Besides, you don't erase the entire line. You just erase parts of it and then start there. Afterwards, you just draw while using that line.[/bq]
Tell that to my art teacher

I've had to erase almost entire fully shaded drawings because i made a mistake with the proportions or something[/bq]

I know how you feel. Art teachers are probably why I'm uncertain about everything.  

My art teacher is like a hawk when it comes to making mistakes. _Extremely_ meticulous. 

We do personal projects, which are due every three weeks. When we complete them, my teacher will dig into each individual piece of art like a grave robber. Heck, he can go on for an entire period just explaining how just one of my classmate's paintings can be improved. 

He especially goes after me for the misplacement of colors and values. He's not mean or anything, he just has that calm, bedtime story voice. I usually bring a small pillow I made back in middle school to class for cushioning on my arms, but on the days he does critiques, I feel like laying down on it and catching up on the sleep I missed the previous night. Not out of disrespect, because I try my hardest to stay awake. Darn insomnia.
